sentences.en: A mark of disgrace or dishonor ; a reproach or slur.
sentences.cn: 耻辱不名誉之痕迹;玷辱; 污点.

sentences.en: And then you slur by dropping initial letters and diphthongs.'
sentences.cn: 有时你又把单词开头的辅音和双元音含糊掉.

sentences.en: Any suggestion that I accepted bribes would be a monstrous slur.
sentences.cn: 谁说我受贿就是对我恶意中伤.
不要破坏我兄弟的名声!

sentences.en: Flemming is enraged by this slur.
sentences.cn: 弗莱明为这种侮辱所激怒.

sentences.en: He took the remarks as a slur on his reputation.
sentences.cn: 他把这些话当作是对他的名誉的中伤.

sentences.en: His comments cast a slur on the integrity of his employees.
sentences.cn: 他的评论是对其雇员正直品质的诋毁.
他的声音听起来含混不清。

sentences.en: It is immoral to cast a slur on a person's reputation.
sentences.cn: 中伤别人的名誉是不道德的.
许多人总是把这类事说得很含糊.

sentences.en: She tried to keep her reputation free from slur.
That was an awful slur, but it wasn't really surprising.
sentences.cn: 这是无耻的诽谤, 但是实际上也不足为奇.

sentences.en: The drug made her speak with a slur.
The newscaster's speech began to slur.
sentences.cn: 新闻广播员的话音变得含糊不清起来。

sentences.en: They regard it as a slur on their own cooking, of cleaning, or furniture.
sentences.cn: 他们认为这是诋毁自家的饭菜, 或整洁, 或家具.

sentences.en: This is yet another slur on the integrity of the Metropolitan Police.
sentences.cn: 这是对伦敦市警察局刚正廉明作风的又一次诽谤。

words.tran_cn: 略过；含糊不清地说出（slur的过去式）
含糊地发音；潦草地写字；拖着脚走

trans.tran_en: an unfair criticism that is intended to make people dislike someone or something
to speak unclearly without separating your words or sounds correctly
